heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 21 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.4°C) and outside temperature (down 1.9°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 2.1°C) and feels like temperature (up 2.5°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 200.3m higher than yesterday, 36.7m lower than the past week, 321.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 697m to 1474m and averaged 1155.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

pressure.description:
Today’s average pressure is 3.2 mbar higher than yesterday, 11.8 mbar lower than the past week, 24.3 mbar lower than the past month.

The pressures yesterday fell between 985 mbar minimum and 992 mbar maximum, with an average of 991.9 mbar; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1003.6 mbar and 1016.2 mbar.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and near calm conditions. Chance of light rain, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and a mix of sun and clouds. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
